data.title: Members - The Trapani Lab at Amherst College
data.snippet:
#### Ha Dong '26

'26 Neuroscience Thesis Student  
 Former Lab Research Student  
 Ha is a senior from Hanoi, Vietnam, tri-majoring in Physics, Mathematics, and Neuroscience. Ha is interested in how different sensory modalities shape behaviors and plans to pursue a Ph.D. degree. Outside the lab, Ha works with the Center for Teaching and Learning and the Strategic Learning Center to help improve the teaching and learning on campus. In his free time, you would find him taking photographs or biking along the Norwottuck Rail Trail, trying out new coffee recipes, or jamming with friends with his cajon. Learn more about him here: 

#### Shirley Fu '26 [...] #### Allie Platt '26

'26 Neuroscience Thesis Student  
 Allie Platt (she/her) is a senior from Brooklyn, New York. She is majoring in neuroscience on the pre-med track. Outside the lab, she is co-founder and co-president of the figure skating club, an EMT on ACEMS, and a Peer Educator. In her free time, she loves to listen to music (tune in to Hyperfixstation on WAMH), explore a new coffee shop, and travel.

#### Ha Dong '26 [...] #### Varun Iyengar '14

2014 Neuroscience honors thesis student  
 2012 HHMI Summer research student  
 Varun is at Brown Medical school. He was formerly an associate at Close Concerns in San Francisco, California.

#### Kelsey Ayers '15

2013 lab fishroom technician  
 Kelsey is a Thoracic Surgery lab assistant at Stanford School of Medicine. While at Amherst, she was Biology major and a captain on the varsity softball team.

#### Jenna Browning-Kamins '13

2013 Neuroscience honors thesis student  
 2013 Summer postbac fellow  
 Jenna is currently in the Audiology (AuD) program at Northwestern University. Jenna was also a research technician in Richard Axel's lab at Columbia University.

#### Niklas Smedemark-Margulies '13

data.title: Neuroscience | Majors
data.snippet:
About the Major

### Seminars

In the Neuroscience Seminars & Comprehensives, students and faculty discuss current research and guest neuroscientists lecture on their work.

Neuroscience Seminars

### Student Research

Our majors perform lab research at Amherst and around the country. Seniors have the option to complete an honors research project.

Neuroscience Research

### History

Amherst was the first institution to offer an undergraduate major in neuroscience.

Department History

### Summer Porgrams

Our majors take great advantage of neuroscience research opportunities around the country and internationally.

Summer Programs

### After Amherst [...] Skip to primary navigation
 Skip to section menu
 Skip to footer

Amherst College

Amherst College

Menu   Tools

# Neuroscience

Amherst Neuroscience students work closely with faculty to seek answers to long-nagging questions about the brain.

## Section Navigation

How does the mind work? How can we explain animal and human behavior? What is different when someone is not neurotypical? Neuroscience is the modern attempt to answer these and other questions through the study of the brain.

## Program Highlights

### The Major

The neuroscience major is highly interdisciplinary, with students taking courses in biology, chemistry, psychology, mathematics, physics and more.

About the Major

### Seminars [...] Summer Programs

### After Amherst

Amherst neuroscience majors conduct research at the National Institutes of Health, teach high school in Boston, practice medicine around the country and work in business.

Neuroscience Graduates

## Neuroscience Courses

Current Courses 

NEUR 213

### Neuroscience: Systems and Behavior

Description

This course will examine how brain function regulates a broad range of mental processes and behaviors. We will discuss how neurons work and how the brain obtains information about the environment, regulates an organism’s response to the environment, and controls basic functions necessary for survival.

NEUR 301

### Molecular Neurobiology with Lab

Description

data.title: Break Through Tech AI Information Portal | Ha Dong - LinkedIn
data.snippet:
# Ha Dong’s Post

Ha Dong

 Report this post

I’m happy to share that I have been accepted to Break Through Tech AI at MIT Schwarzman College of Computing! Starting this June, I will be joining an 18-month fellowship to further technical skills critical for machine learning and AI applications, which I hope to integrate into my future research career in life sciences and healthcare. I owe a huge thank you to Arjun Kejriwal and Pranjal Chalise for introducing me to this incredible opportunity! The application for this year’s program is open until March 18! You can learn more and apply here:

Break Through Tech AI Information Portal
